intro: Triodanis, commonly known as the three-lobed bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and are characterized by their bell-shaped, often blue or violet-colored flowers. Their flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to their ecological significance.
